Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2009 11:04AM helene333 wrote: thanks for your responses, I agree 100 percent that early detection is the most important thing..... and I can handle the stress long as I prepare myself. I just have a very stong feeling that they will something on this MRI. Just a feeling, though. I hope I'm wrong. When I read some of the stories here, I am amazed at the emotional strength and wisdom of the women affected by BC.

Posts.Content: helene333 wrote: It seems to me that a lot of women here are dealing with the issue of having dense breast tissue and are therefore adviced to have an MRI. (I am one of them)  Of those with dense breasts, what has been your experience with MRI? A lot of false positives (and the stress associated with them)? The finding of suspicious lesions missed by mammograms and ultrasound? Or both? Log in to post a reply
